problem_text:
If the p-th powers in a finite p-group form a subgroup, must that subgroup be powerful? That is, for p ≠ 2, if the p-th powers in a p-group of exponent p2 form a subgroup, must that subgroup be abelian? For a 2-group of exponent 8, if the squares form a subgroup, must that subgroup be abelian?
L. Wilson
